objective.label: Target 1.3
objective.description: Implement nationally appropriate social protection systems and measures for all, including floors, and by 2030 achieve substantial coverage of the poor and the vulnerable

relations.label: Target 2.1
relations.description: By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round

relations.label: Target 2.2
relations.description: By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving, by 2025 the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women and older persons

relations.label: Target 2.3
relations.description: By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers, in particular women, indigenous peoples, family farmers, pastoralists and fishers, including through secure and equal access to land, other productive resources and inputs, knowledge, financial services, markets and opportunities for value addition and non-farm employment

relations.label: Target 2.4
relations.description: By 2030, ensure sustainable food production systems and implement resilient agricultural practices that increase productivity and production, that help maintain ecosystems, that strengthen capacity for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality

relations.label: Target 3.5
relations.description: Strengthen the prevention and treatment of substance abuse, including narcotic drug abuse and harmful use of alcohol

relations.label: Target 4.2
relations.description: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys have access to quality early childhood development, care and preprimary education so that they are ready for primary education

relations.label: Target 4.3
relations.description: By 2030, ensure equal access for all women and men to affordable and quality technical, vocational and tertiary education, including university

relations.label: Target 4.4
relations.description: By 2030, substantially increase the number of youth and adults who have relevant skills, including technical and vocational skills, for employment, decent jobs and entrepreneurship

relations.label: Target 4.a
relations.description: Build and upgrade education facilities that are child, disability and gender sensitive and provide safe, non-violent, inclusive and effective learning environments for all

relations.label: Target 5.1
relations.description: End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere

relations.label: Target 6.1
relations.description: By 2030, achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all

relations.label: Target 6.3
relations.description: By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse globally

relations.label: Target 6.4
relations.description: By 2030, substantially increase water-use efficiency across all sectors and ensure sustainable withdrawals and supply of freshwater to address water scarcity and substantially reduce the number of people suffering from water scarcity

relations.label: Target 6.6
relations.description: By 2020, protect and restore water-related ecosystems, including mountains, forests, wetlands, rivers, aquifers and lakes

relations.label: Target 7.2
relations.description: By 2030, increase substantially the share of renewable energy in the global energy mix

relations.label: Target 8.2
relations.description: Achieve higher levels of economic productivity through diversification, technological upgrading and innovation, including through a focus on high-value added and labour-intensive sectors

relations.label: Target 8.3
relations.description: Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services

relations.label: Target 8.9
relations.description: By 2030, devise and implement policies to promote sustainable tourism that creates jobs and promotes local culture and products

relations.label: Target 8.10
relations.description: Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all

relations.label: Target 9.3
relations.description: Increase the access of small-scale industrial and other enterprises, in particular in developing countries, to financial services, including affordable credit, and their integration into value chains and markets

relations.label: Target 10.3
relations.description: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard

relations.label: Target 10.4
relations.description: Adopt policies, especially fiscal, wage and social protection policies, and progressively achieve greater equality

relations.label: Target 11.1
relations.description: By 2030, ensure access for all to adequate, safe and affordable housing and basic services and upgrade slums

relations.label: Target 11.2
relations.description: By 2030, provide access to safe, affordable, accessible and sustainable transport systems for all, improving road safety, notably by expanding public transport, with special attention to the needs of those in vulnerable situations, women, children, persons with disabilities and older persons

relations.label: Target 12.2
relations.description: By 2030, achieve the sustainable management and efficient use of natural resources

relations.label: Target 13.2
relations.description: Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning

relations.label: Target 13.3
relations.description: Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning

relations.label: Target 14.1
relations.description: By 2025, prevent and significantly reduce marine pollution of all kinds, in particular from land-based activities, including marine debris and nutrient pollution

relations.label: Target 14.4
relations.description: By 2020, effectively regulate harvesting and end overfishing, illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and destructive fishing practices and implement science-based management plans, in order to restore fish stocks in the shortest time feasible, at least to levels that can produce maximum sustainable yield as determined by their biological characteristics

relations.label: Target 15.1
relations.description: By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and drylands, in line with obligations under international agreements

relations.label: Target 15.9
relations.description: By 2020, integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning, development processes, poverty reduction strategies and accounts

relations.label: Target 16.5
relations.description: Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms

relations.label: Target 16.10
relations.description: Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements

relations.label: Target 17.14
relations.description: Enhance policy coherence for sustainable development

relations.label: Target 17.19
relations.description: By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries

relations.label: Target 15.1
relations.description: By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and drylands, in line with obligations under international agreements

relations.label: Target 15.9
relations.description: By 2020, integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning, development processes, poverty reduction strategies and accounts

relations.label: Target 16.5
relations.description: Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms

relations.label: Target 16.10
relations.description: Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements

relations.label: Target 17.19
relations.description: By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries

objective.label: Target 17.19
objective.description: By 2030, build on existing initiatives to develop measurements of progress on sustainable development that complement gross domestic product, and support statistical capacity-building in developing countries

relations.label: Target 1.3
relations.description: Implement nationally appropriate social protection systems and measures for all, including floors, and by 2030 achieve substantial coverage of the poor and the vulnerable

relations.label: Target 2.1
relations.description: By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people, in particular the poor and people in vulnerable situations, including infants to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round

relations.label: Target 2.2
relations.description: By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving, by 2025 the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women and older persons

relations.label: Target 2.3
relations.description: By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers, in particular women, indigenous peoples, family farmers, pastoralists and fishers, including through secure and equal access to land, other productive resources and inputs, knowledge, financial services, markets and opportunities for value addition and non-farm employment

relations.label: Target 2.4
relations.description: By 2030, ensure sustainable food production systems and implement resilient agricultural practices that increase productivity and production, that help maintain ecosystems, that strengthen capacity for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality

relations.label: Target 3.5
relations.description: Strengthen the prevention and treatment of substance abuse, including narcotic drug abuse and harmful use of alcohol

relations.label: Target 4.2
relations.description: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys have access to quality early childhood development, care and preprimary education so that they are ready for primary education

relations.label: Target 4.3
relations.description: By 2030, ensure equal access for all women and men to affordable and quality technical, vocational and tertiary education, including university

relations.label: Target 4.4
relations.description: By 2030, substantially increase the number of youth and adults who have relevant skills, including technical and vocational skills, for employment, decent jobs and entrepreneurship

relations.label: Target 4.a
relations.description: Build and upgrade education facilities that are child, disability and gender sensitive and provide safe, non-violent, inclusive and effective learning environments for all

relations.label: Target 5.1
relations.description: End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere

relations.label: Target 6.1
relations.description: By 2030, achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all

relations.label: Target 6.3
relations.description: By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse globally

relations.label: Target 6.4
relations.description: By 2030, substantially increase water-use efficiency across all sectors and ensure sustainable withdrawals and supply of freshwater to address water scarcity and substantially reduce the number of people suffering from water scarcity

relations.label: Target 6.6
relations.description: By 2020, protect and restore water-related ecosystems, including mountains, forests, wetlands, rivers, aquifers and lakes

relations.label: Target 7.2
relations.description: By 2030, increase substantially the share of renewable energy in the global energy mix

relations.label: Target 8.2
relations.description: Achieve higher levels of economic productivity through diversification, technological upgrading and innovation, including through a focus on high-value added and labour-intensive sectors

relations.label: Target 8.3
relations.description: Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services

relations.label: Target 8.9
relations.description: By 2030, devise and implement policies to promote sustainable tourism that creates jobs and promotes local culture and products

relations.label: Target 8.10
relations.description: Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all

relations.label: Target 9.3
relations.description: Increase the access of small-scale industrial and other enterprises, in particular in developing countries, to financial services, including affordable credit, and their integration into value chains and markets

relations.label: Target 10.3
relations.description: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard

relations.label: Target 10.4
relations.description: Adopt policies, especially fiscal, wage and social protection policies, and progressively achieve greater equality

relations.label: Target 11.1
relations.description: By 2030, ensure access for all to adequate, safe and affordable housing and basic services and upgrade slums

relations.label: Target 11.2
relations.description: By 2030, provide access to safe, affordable, accessible and sustainable transport systems for all, improving road safety, notably by expanding public transport, with special attention to the needs of those in vulnerable situations, women, children, persons with disabilities and older persons

relations.label: Target 12.2
relations.description: By 2030, achieve the sustainable management and efficient use of natural resources

relations.label: Target 13.2
relations.description: Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning

relations.label: Target 13.3
relations.description: Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning

relations.label: Target 14.1
relations.description: By 2025, prevent and significantly reduce marine pollution of all kinds, in particular from land-based activities, including marine debris and nutrient pollution

relations.label: Target 14.4
relations.description: By 2020, effectively regulate harvesting and end overfishing, illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and destructive fishing practices and implement science-based management plans, in order to restore fish stocks in the shortest time feasible, at least to levels that can produce maximum sustainable yield as determined by their biological characteristics

relations.label: Target 15.1
relations.description: By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and drylands, in line with obligations under international agreements

relations.label: Target 15.9
relations.description: By 2020, integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning, development processes, poverty reduction strategies and accounts

relations.label: Target 16.5
relations.description: Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms

relations.label: Target 16.10
relations.description: Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements

relations.label: Target 17.14
relations.description: Enhance policy coherence for sustainable development
